Package src

Class Sphere

java.lang.Object
src.Sphere
public class Sphere
extends java.lang.Object
Java class for creating vertex and buffer data for drawing a sphere using Jogl/OpenGL. Intended to be used for an OpenGL scene renderer. The resolution of the sphere is held as instance variables.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Sphere​(int verticalResolution, int horizontalResolution)  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int getNoOfIndices()
    Returns the number of indices of a sphere for the draw call.
    int[] makeIndicesForTriangleStrip()
    Creates indices for drawing a sphere with glDrawElements().
    float[] makeVertices​(float radius, float[] color)
    Creates vertices for a (UV)-sphere with one single color and normal vectors.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Sphere

      public Sphere​(int verticalResolution, int horizontalResolution)

  • Method Details

    • makeVertices

      public float[] makeVertices​(float radius, float[] color)
      Creates vertices for a (UV)-sphere with one single color and normal vectors. To be used together with makeIndicesForTriangleStrip().
      Parameters:
      radius - radius of the sphere
      color - three dimensional color vector for each vertex
      Returns:
      list of vertices

    • makeIndicesForTriangleStrip

      public int[] makeIndicesForTriangleStrip()
      Creates indices for drawing a sphere with glDrawElements(). To be used together with makeVertices(). To be used with "glDrawElements" and "GL_TRIANGLE_STRIP".
      Returns:
      indices into the vertex array of the sphere

    • getNoOfIndices

      public int getNoOfIndices()
      Returns the number of indices of a sphere for the draw call.
      Returns:
      number of indices the index buffer
